definition: girl from a wealthy family/unmarried daughter of a noble house
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
small arched door/boudoir/lady's chamber/by ext. women
handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears

sentences.english: She was the first "nice" girl he had ever known.
sentences.chinese: 她是他所认识的第一个“大家闺秀”。

sentences.english: The middle one is typical of good family, married a rich man, still not happy.
sentences.chinese: 老二是典型的大家闺秀，嫁了个有钱男，还不开心。

sentences.english: I'm a maiden who grew up in China.
sentences.chinese: 我是在中国长大的大家闺秀。

definition: pretty daughter in a humble family
family with a literary reputation (idiom); literary family
(of a person's manner or character) gentle and quiet
